title: Drawing, 1715–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brown ink,  brush and watercolor on off-white laid paper, lined
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink, lower right:  Oppenort.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper edge of pedestal base: Thur Paris.
provenance: Leon Decloux; in his collection in 1906
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Wall clock with trophy above including a scythe and snake coiled around a globe from which is suspended a bust in profile and an allegorical figure below holding a torche and a cock seated on a bracket decorated with two rams heads on either side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1715–25.
1715–25. Pen and black ink, brown ink,  brush and watercolor on off-white laid paper, lined. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-226.
